# noteHeightOfRows(withIndexesChanged:)

**Instance Method**

Informs the table view that the rows specified in `indexSet` have changed height.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func noteHeightOfRows(withIndexesChanged indexSet: IndexSet)
```

## Parameters

- **indexSet**: Index set of rows that have changed their height.

## Discussion

If the delegate implements [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableViewDelegate/tableView(_:heightOfRow:)] this method immediately retiles the table view using the row heights the delegate provides.

For [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView]-based tables, this method will animate. To turn off the animation, create an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimationContext] grouping and set the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimationContext/duration] to 0. Then call this method and end the grouping.

For [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell]-based tables, this method normally doesn’t animate. However, it will animate if you call it inside a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/beginUpdates()]/[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/endUpdates()] block.

## Layout Support

- **userInterfaceLayoutDirection**: The layout direction of the user interface.
- **rect(ofColumn:)**: Returns the rectangle containing the column at the specified index.
- **rect(ofRow:)**: Returns the rectangle containing the row at the specified index.
- **rows(in:)**: Returns a range of indexes for the rows that lie wholly or partially within the vertical boundaries of the specified rectangle.
- **columnIndexes(in:)**: Returns the indexes of the table view’s columns that intersect the specified rectangle.
- **column(at:)**: Returns the index of the column the specified point lies in.
- **row(at:)**: Returns the index of the row the specified point lies in.
- **frameOfCell(atColumn:row:)**: Returns a rectangle locating the cell that lies at the intersection of the specified column and row.
- **columnAutoresizingStyle**: The table view’s column autoresizing style.
- **sizeLastColumnToFit()**: Resizes the last column so the table view fits exactly within its enclosing clip view.
- **noteNumberOfRowsChanged()**: Informs the table view that the number of records in its data source has changed.
- **tile()**: Properly sizes the table view and its header view and marks it as needing display.
- **sizeToFit()**: Sizes the  table view based on a uniform column autoresizing style.
